repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:  No obvious way to force a 'statuscolumn' rebuild.
Solution: Let :redraw force a 'statuscolumn' rebuild.

comment_regular_data.body: It can already be forced by setting 'statuscolumn' to itself.
Also if `:redraw` forces update for current window, then `:redraw!` should force update for all windows.

> It can already be forced by setting 'statuscolumn' to itself.

Are you saying it is possible to make the added test pass on master? I couldn't find a way to, I'll look at it again later. Even so, I think having `:redraw` force a rebuild makes sense.
Depends on what you mean by "pass on master". If you change `:redraw!` to `:let &stc = &stc` then it "passes on master".

Right, perhaps I typo'd when testing that. 

So do we update the docs to recommend setting `'stc'` to itself or go ahead with modifying `:redraw`?

Thanks for digging into this!

Using `vim.o.statuscolumn = vim.o.statuscolumn` works perfectly in my case.

From a user perspective this _feels_ kinda hacky though. A dedicated command, like maybe `:redrawStatuscolumn`, would be more straightforward in my opinion. This could even just reset the statuscolumn to itself under the hood.

But keeping it as is would be fine by me too. Mentioning this in the docs would be great then.

@zeertzjq care to elaborate on what exactly requires discussion?
I have no immediate need for this but I think it's useful/expected that 'statuscolumn' will build from scratch on `:redraw`. And it's relatively free in the sense that if this changes the 'statuscolumn' width, the entire window would already be redrawn anyways.

> And it's relatively free in the sense that if this changes the 'statuscolumn' width, the entire window would already be redrawn anyways.

Actually I suppose that's only true for `:redraw!`, not `:redraw`. Maybe moving this to `:redrawstatus` makes more sense then.
`:redraw` "redraws **pending** screen updates", so "build from scratch" is definitely not "expected".

> `:redraw` "redraws **pending** screen updates", so "build from scratch" is definitely not "expected".

Yes, that's what I said in my edit. Thoughts on doing this in `redrawstatus`?
I think that makes more sense.

My last attempt at this, if a new command is deemed unwarranted, I guess we just add the workaround to the docs. 

Pairing a rebuild of the statuscolumn with `:redrawstatus` seems less than ideal, because it is much more expensive than just redrawing the status lines.

The `vim.o.statuscolumn = vim.o.statuscolumn` workaround is less than ideal because it does unnecessary option value/statusline-format checking.

> The vim.o.statuscolumn = vim.o.statuscolumn workaround is less than ideal because it does unnecessary option value/statusline-format checking.

Yes, and we don't want to further propagate such hacks (`&bg=&bg`, anyone)?

If a custom Vimscript command is not acceptable (and we've long had the policy of "vimscript interface belongs to vim; we don't make changes"), we might want to think about a Lua API `vim.redraw(opts)` that allows for more fine-grained control.

Yeah `vim.redraw()` might be nice to have, I would be willing to take a stab at that in place of this PR if a new command is unwanted. But I think in this case `:redrawstatuscolumn` helps with discoverability next to `:redraw/status/tabline`.

> Pairing a rebuild of the statuscolumn with :redrawstatus seems less than ideal, because it is much more expensive than just redrawing the status lines.

Is this really a problem in practice?

> > Pairing a rebuild of the statuscolumn with :redrawstatus seems less than ideal, because it is much more expensive than just redrawing the status lines.
> 
> Is this really a problem in practice?

I mean probably not but I think `:redrawstatus` is used too often (by plugins) to have it force redraw the entire screen when `'statuscolumn'` is set. The situation this new command addresses seems quite niche, I think it shouldn't affect the common case.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

labels.description: For PRs that propose significant changes to some part of the architecture or API
labels.name: needs:discussion

title: feat(column): add :redrawstatuscolumn to rebuild 'statuscolumn'
